parts.text:
Take this project/skill summary and create a professional LinkedIn post:

Project/Skill Summary: 
{{3.result}}

Format the output as:
Headline: [Create a compelling professional headline showcasing the skill/project]

Summary: [Rewrite the summary in 2–3 professional sentences highlighting technical/academic relevance]

Key Learning:
[Highlight the main skill/technology demonstrated]
[Explain its relevance to industry or future career]
[Note the potential impact or application]

Engagement: [Add a thoughtful question to spark professional discussion with peers/recruiters]

Tone: Professional, skill-focused, aspirational
Add 3–5 relevant professional/tech hashtags
Length: 150–200 words

IMPORTANT:
1. Start with exciting line like: I have achieved or completed.....
2. Provide only the final message output. Do not include introductory phrases, special formatting characters, or any AI commentary. Output the message content only.

parts.text:
Transform this project/skill summary into an engaging Facebook post:

Project/Skill Summary: {{3.result}}


Structure:
Hook: [Create an engaging opening – question or interesting angle about the project/skill]

Personal Connection: [Relate the project/skill to your personal learning journey or everyday student life]

Community Question: [Ask peers/followers for their thoughts, feedback, or similar experiences]

Tone: Friendly, conversational, relatable
Add 2–3 broad hashtags
Include 1–2 appropriate emojis
Length: 100–150 words

IMPORTANT:
1. Start with exciting line like: I have achieved or completed.....
2. Provide only the final message output. Do not include introductory phrases, special formatting characters, or any AI commentary. Output the message content only.

parts.text:
Convert this project/skill summary into a Telegram bot message:

Project/Skill Summary: {{3.result}}

Format as:
[Punchy headline showcasing the skill/project]

Key Learning:
[Main achievement/skill applied]
[Key learning or outcome]
[Real-world relevance or application]

Takeaway: [One sentence impact statement on why this skill/project matters]

Style: Mobile-friendly, scannable, emoji-enhanced
Length: 80–120 words maximum
Use bullets and emojis for easy reading

IMPORTANT:
1. Start with exciting line like: I have achieved or completed.....
2. Provide only the final message output. Do not include introductory phrases, special formatting characters, or any AI commentary. Output the message content only.
